name: Database Systems
content: Introduction to database systems, Data modelling, RDBMS concepts, Database query languages, Database programming techniques, Introduction to indexes and query optimization, Introduction to transaction processing, Database Project

modules.description: Information models and Systems, Database system evolution, File based systems, DBMS approach, Database environment and components, DBMS functions, DBMS architecture, Data independence, Database system life cycle
Importance of data modelling in system development; Levels of abstraction and practice; Conceptual models; ER/EER and UML; Logical models; Relational and OO Models, Relational mapping
Relational algebra and relational calculus; Relational integrity, Normalization; 1NF, 2NF, 3NF and BCNF; Object oriented extensions
4GL environments; SQL; DDL, DML and DCL; Triggers; Views
Embedded SQL; Database programming with function/procedure calls; ODBC, JDBC; Stored procedures

modules.topic: Introduction to indexes and query optimization
modules.description: Types of indexes; primary and secondary indexes, Query optimization; rule based and cost based approaches
Transactions, ACID properties, Concurrency control, Serialization, Failure and recovery

references: Ramez Elmasri and Shamkant B. Navathe, Fundamentals of Database Systems 7th Edition, 2016
Raghu Ramakrishnan and Johannes Gehrke, Database Management Systems, 3rd Edition, McGrawHill, 2004
